page.title: 04Local History of Stithians.
page.content: Stithians local history society has been meeting every six weeks for ten years.It has four working members, who aim to publish a booklet every two years. The next one will be on Tregonning Mill. In the 19C there were forty mills, powder, corn and paper, along the river Kennall, but only Tregonning mill, a listed building maintained by the National Trust remains. Quarrying and mining were important industries now the area is mainly farming. An old Cornish saying claims that wherever there is a hole in the ground you will find a Cornishman at the bottom. Miners from Stithians emigrated all over the world; few people emigrate today. The old Stithians family names are, Dunstan, Gluyas, Knuckey, Martin, Moyle, Odgers, Opie and Thomas.
